alert.note: Alert for Forrest (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 2:03PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Forrest County through 230 PM CST... At 203 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Maxie, or 7 miles northwest of Wiggins, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Forrest County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southeastern Mississippi.
